intro: Capurodendron delphinense, commonly known as the Delphinine Tree, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and trees. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It produces small, fleshy berries that are an important food source for local wildlife. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
